intro: Romulea elegans var. parviflora, commonly known as the dwarf crown orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bulbous rhizomes and grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant, white or pale pink flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated by gardeners interested in rare and exotic plants.
